alert.note: Alert for Orofino, Grangeville Region; Southern Clearwater Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 6:30PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Idaho and southwestern Clearwater Counties through 615 PM PDT... At 530 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles southeast of Kooskia to near Nezperce. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kooskia, East Kamiah, Stites, Winona, Glenwood, Greer, Syringa, Pardee, and Woodland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Orofino, Grangeville Region; Southern Clearwater Mountains
